Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: sketch of a leopardess in battle with a sea monster

Clouds fill the upper portion of the painting, clearly in storm billowed poignantly by the wind. The sun is hitting them, adding a myriad of red-gold hues to the already imposing deep blues and dark purples of the broiling storm. Beneath the clouds lies a storm swept sea, all jagged jade peeks and murky green troughs filled with the jetsam of a ruined boat. Standing on the remains of what appears to be the mast stands a tiny buxom leopardess, the dying light of the sun catching her moonlight silver hair, one of her sharp silver eyes is cut and the blood covers her the left side of her face, though not completely visible from the angle the deep, dramatic red of her blood catches your eye as it taints her silky, snow white fur. She is holding a burnished silver sword aloft, catching the light causing it to appear as if it were shrouded with flames. Before her is a gigantic monster with multiple heads, all spewing a viscous dirty green liquid. Their fangs are long and jagged, the spines on their myriad, intertwining necks are fearsome and huge. The water beneath them is boiling and plume filled as they roil in their indignant anger. The wounds she has delivered to it's necks are severe and gaping, oozing an unnatural vibrantly blue blood. It appears that the leopardess is triumphing over the beast, her pose one of victory, the heads are seem to be yowling in furious and defeated anger. In the left corner of the painting is a an "S" made of sea foam, showing who the artist was. This sketch is superb.
An oil painting of a leopardess engaged in an epic conflict with a huge multi-headed sea monster beneath a dramatic sky.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: "An oil painting of a leopardess engaged in an epic conflict with a huge multi-headed sea monster beneath a dramatic sky."
